answerText: Heisenberg uncertainty principle[10] The Heisenberg uncertainty principle applies to variables that have this relationship, in which the two variables are Fourier transform duals. The variables in the Maxwell relations also have this relationship.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 4 | 19 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This relation can be found by taking the commutator of two variables, then finding the standard deviation of those two variables. [10] Name this result, which states that certain pairs of variables can only be measured to a certain precision. This relation applies to momentum and position, as well as energy and time.
